Key Match Events: Memphis led by 10 for a decent chunk of the first half, but a 14-2 run toward the end of the first half gave the Grizzlies the lead.
A strong start to the third quarter for Memphis would put them up by double-digits, and they wouldn't look back from there.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavs were without Luka Doncic, and Kyrie Irving has been ruled out for at least 1-2 weeks with a bulging disc in his back.
Memphis was playing without Ja Morant, Desmond Bane, Marcus Smart, GG Jackson, and more.
Others: Dallas led by 10 for a decent chunk of the first half, but a 14-2 run toward the end of the first half gave the Grizzlies the lead.
A strong start to the third quarter for Memphis would put them up by double-digits, and they wouldn't look back from there.
The Grizzlies shot 27/35 from the free-throw line, while Dallas was 11/15.
Jay Huff, who completely changed the game for Memphis.
Dallas' biggest issue without Luka Doncic and Kyrie Irving is they have no one who can consistently get a bucket.
